definition: to bend at the waist/to bow/(fig.) to bow to/to submit
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

waist/lower back/pocket/middle/loins

sentences.english: Such things can never make my heart rejoice.
sentences.chinese: 安能摧眉折腰事權貴，使我不得開心顏。

sentences.english: He does not compromised your character to obtain it spirit has been posterity praise.
sentences.chinese: 他不爲五斗米折腰的精神一直被後人稱讚。

sentences.english: Never bend your head. Always hold it high.
sentences.chinese: 永恆不要折腰，要一直把頭舉高。

sentences.english: Which ancient Chinese government official resigned because he refused to bow for five bushels of grain?
sentences.chinese: 因“不爲五斗米而折腰”而辭官的是以下哪一位？

sentences.english: If you don't stand for something, you will fall for anything.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不堅持一些東西，你就會爲任何事情折腰。
